00039 
00040 lbann::Layer::Layer(const uint index, lbann_comm* comm, Optimizer *optimizer,
00041                     uint mbsize, activation_type activation,
00042                     std::vector<regularizer*> regs)
00043   : m_activation_type(activation), optimizer(optimizer), comm(comm),
00044     regularizers(regs), m_mini_batch_size(mbsize),
00045     m_effective_mbsize(mbsize),
00046     fp_time(0.0), bp_time(0.0)
00047 {
00048     Index = index;
00049     m_execution_mode = execution_mode::training;
00050     fp_input = NULL;
00051     bp_input = NULL;
00052 
00053     // Most layers use standard elemental matrix distribution
00054     WB = new DistMat(comm->get_model_grid());
00055     WB_D = new DistMat(comm->get_model_grid());
00056     Zs = new DistMat(comm->get_model_grid());
00057     Ds = new DistMat(comm->get_model_grid());
00058     Ds_Temp = new DistMat(comm->get_model_grid());
00059     Acts = new DistMat(comm->get_model_grid());
00060 
00061     // Initialize activation function
00062     m_activation_fn = new_activation(activation);
00063 
00064 }
00065 
00066 lbann::Layer::~Layer() {
00067   delete m_activation_fn;
00068   delete WB;
00069   delete WB_D;
00070   delete Zs;
00071   delete Ds;
00072   delete Ds_Temp;
00073   delete Acts;
00074 }
00075 
00076 DataType lbann::Layer::forwardProp(DataType prev_WBL2NormSum) {
00077   double fp_start = get_time();
00078   // Apply connection regularization. (e.g. DropConnect).
00079   for (regularizer* reg : regularizers) reg->fp_connections();
00080   // Layer layer's linearity.
00081   fp_linearity(*WB, *fp_input, *Zs, *Acts);
00082   // Apply weight regularization (e.g. L2 normalization).
00083   for (regularizer* reg : regularizers) reg->fp_weights();
00084   // Apply activation function/nonlinearity.
00085   fp_nonlinearity();
00086   // Apply activation regularization (e.g. Dropout).
00087   for (regularizer* reg : regularizers) reg->fp_activations();
00088   fp_time += get_time() - fp_start;
00089   return prev_WBL2NormSum;
00090 }
00091 
00092 void lbann::Layer::backProp() {
00093   double bp_start = get_time();
00094 
00095   // Get incoming loss and convert matrix distribution if necessary
00096   *Ds = *bp_input;
00097   // Backprop activation regularization.
00098   for (regularizer* reg : regularizers) reg->bp_activations();
00099   // Backprop the activation function/nonlinearity.
00100   bp_nonlinearity();
00101   // Backprop weight regularization.
00102   for (regularizer* reg : regularizers) reg->bp_weights();
00103   // Backprop the layer's linearity.
00104   bp_linearity();
00105   // Backprop connection regularization.
00106   for (regularizer* reg : regularizers) reg->bp_connections();
00107   bp_time += get_time() - bp_start;
00108 }
00109 
00110 void lbann::Layer::summarize(lbann_summary& summarizer, int64_t step) {
00111   std::string prefix = "layer" + std::to_string(static_cast<long long>(Index)) + "/WB/";
00112   // TODO: implement summarizer functions for other matrix distributions
00113   const ElMat& wb = get_weights_biases();
00114   summarizer.reduce_mean(prefix + "mean", wb, step);
00115   summarizer.reduce_min(prefix + "min", wb, step);
00116   summarizer.reduce_max(prefix + "max", wb, step);
00117   summarizer.reduce_stdev(prefix + "stdev", wb, step);
00118   prefix = "layer" + std::to_string(static_cast<long long>(Index)) + "/WB_D/";
00119   const ElMat& wb_d = get_weights_biases_gradient();
00120   summarizer.reduce_mean(prefix + "mean", wb_d, step);
00121   summarizer.reduce_min(prefix + "min", wb_d, step);
00122   summarizer.reduce_max(prefix + "max", wb_d, step);
00123   summarizer.reduce_stdev(prefix + "stdev", wb_d, step);
00124   prefix = "layer" + std::to_string(static_cast<long long>(Index)) + "/Acts/";
00125   const ElMat& acts = get_activations();
00126   summarizer.reduce_mean(prefix + "mean", acts, step);
00127   summarizer.reduce_min(prefix + "min", acts, step);
00128   summarizer.reduce_max(prefix + "max", acts, step);
00129   summarizer.reduce_stdev(prefix + "stdev", acts, step);
00130   prefix = "layer" + std::to_string(static_cast<long long>(Index)) + "/";
00131   summarizer.reduce_scalar(prefix + "fp_time", fp_time, step);
00132   summarizer.reduce_scalar(prefix + "bp_time", bp_time, step);
00133   reset_counters();
00134 }
00135 
00136 void lbann::Layer::setup(int) {
00137   for (regularizer* reg : regularizers) reg->setup(this);
00138 }
00139 
00140 ElMat *lbann::Layer::fp_output() {
00141   return Acts;
00142 }
00143 
00144 ElMat *lbann::Layer::bp_output() {
00145   return Ds_Temp;
00146 }

00159 
00160 struct layer_header {
00161     uint64_t rank;
00162     uint64_t width;
00163     uint64_t height;
00164     uint64_t localwidth;
00165     uint64_t localheight;
00166     uint64_t ldim;
00167 };
00168 
00169 static bool writeDist(int fd, const char* filename, const DistMat& M, uint64_t* bytes)
00170 {
00171     struct layer_header header;
00172     header.rank        = (uint64_t) M.Grid().Rank();
00173     header.width       = (uint64_t) M.Width();
00174     header.height      = (uint64_t) M.Height();
00175     header.localwidth  = (uint64_t) M.LocalWidth();
00176     header.localheight = (uint64_t) M.LocalHeight();
00177     header.ldim        = (uint64_t) M.LDim();
00178 
00179     ssize_t write_rc = write(fd, &header, sizeof(header));
00180     if (write_rc != sizeof(header)) {
00181         // error!
00182     }
00183     *bytes += write_rc;
00184 
00185     const Int localHeight = M.LocalHeight();
00186     const Int localWidth = M.LocalWidth();
00187     const Int lDim = M.LDim();
00188     if(localHeight == lDim) {
00189         void* buf = (void*) M.LockedBuffer();
00190         size_t bufsize = localHeight * localWidth * sizeof(DataType);
00191         write_rc = write(fd, buf, bufsize);
00192         if (write_rc != bufsize) {
00193             // error!
00194         }
00195         *bytes += write_rc;
00196     } else {
00197         for(Int j = 0; j < localWidth; ++j) {
00198             void* buf = (void*) M.LockedBuffer(0, j);
00199             size_t bufsize = localHeight * sizeof(DataType);
00200             write_rc = write(fd, buf, bufsize);
00201             if (write_rc != bufsize) {
00202                 // error!
00203             }
00204             *bytes += write_rc;
00205         }
00206     }
00207 
00208     return true;
00209 }
00210 
00211 static bool readDist(int fd, const char* filename, DistMat& M, uint64_t* bytes)
00212 {
00213     struct layer_header header;
00214     ssize_t read_rc = read(fd, &header, sizeof(header));
00215     if (read_rc != sizeof(header)) {
00216         // error!
00217     }
00218     *bytes += read_rc;
00219 
00220     // check that header values match up
00221 
00222     Int height = header.height;
00223     Int width  = header.width;
00224     M.Resize(height, width);
00225 
00226     if(M.ColStride() == 1 && M.RowStride() == 1) {
00227         if(M.Height() == M.LDim()) {
00228             void* buf = (void*) M.Buffer();
00229             size_t bufsize = height * width * sizeof(DataType);
00230             read_rc = read(fd, buf, bufsize);
00231             if (read_rc != bufsize) {
00232                 // error!
00233             }
00234             *bytes += read_rc;
00235         } else {
00236             for(Int j = 0; j < width; ++j) {
00237                 void* buf = (void*) M.Buffer(0, j);
00238                 size_t bufsize = height * sizeof(DataType);
00239                 read_rc = read(fd, buf, bufsize);
00240                 if (read_rc != bufsize) {
00241                     // error!
00242                 }
00243                 *bytes += read_rc;
00244             }
00245         }
00246     } else {
00247         const Int localHeight = M.LocalHeight();
00248         const Int localWidth = M.LocalWidth();
00249         const Int lDim = M.LDim();
00250         if(localHeight == lDim) {
00251             void* buf = (void*) M.Buffer();
00252             size_t bufsize = localHeight * localWidth * sizeof(DataType);
00253             read_rc = read(fd, buf, bufsize);
00254             if (read_rc != bufsize) {
00255                 // error!
00256             }
00257             *bytes += read_rc;
00258         } else {
00259             for(Int jLoc = 0; jLoc < localWidth; ++jLoc) {
00260                 void* buf = (void*) M.Buffer(0, jLoc);
00261                 size_t bufsize = localHeight * sizeof(DataType);
00262                 read_rc = read(fd, buf, bufsize);
00263                 if (read_rc != bufsize) {
00264                     // error!
00265                 }
00266                 *bytes += read_rc;
00267             }
00268         }
00269     }
00270     return true;
00271 }
00272 
00273 // TODO: we could cache these datatypes on Matrix object
00274 static void create_types(const DistMatrix<DataType> &M, MPI_Datatype* mattype, MPI_Datatype* viewtype)
00275 {
00276     // initialize to known values
00277     *mattype  = MPI_DATATYPE_NULL;
00278     *viewtype = MPI_DATATYPE_NULL;
00279 
00280     // TODO: use TypeMap<>() and templating to figure this out
00281     MPI_Datatype type = DataTypeMPI;
00282 
00283     // get global width and height of matrix
00284     Int global_width  = M.Width();
00285     Int global_height = M.Height();
00286 
00287     // get local width and height, plus leading dimension of local matrix
00288     Int W    = M.LocalWidth();
00289     Int H    = M.LocalHeight();
00290     Int LDim = M.LDim();
00291 
00292     // create a datatype to describe libelemental data in memory,
00293     // data is stored in column-major order with a local height of H
00294     // and a local width of W, also the leading dimension LDim >= H
00295     // so there may be holes in our local buffer between consecutive
00296     // columns which we need to account for
00297 
00298     // first we have H consecutive elements in a column
00299     MPI_Datatype tmptype;
00300     MPI_Type_contiguous(H, type, &tmptype);
00301 
00302     // then there may be some holes at then end of our column,
00303     // since LDim >= H
00304     MPI_Datatype coltype;
00305     MPI_Aint extent = LDim * sizeof(DataType);
00306     MPI_Type_create_resized(tmptype, 0, extent, &coltype);
00307     MPI_Type_free(&tmptype);
00308 
00309     // finally we have W such columns
00310     MPI_Type_contiguous(W, coltype, mattype);
00311     MPI_Type_free(&coltype);
00312     MPI_Type_commit(mattype);
00313 
00314     // create datatype to desribe fileview for a collective IO operation
00315     // we will store matrix in column-major order in the file
00316 
00317     // get width and height of the process grid
00318     int rank    = M.Grid().Rank();
00319     int ranks   = M.Grid().Size();
00320     int pheight = M.Grid().Height();
00321     int pwidth  = M.Grid().Width();
00322 
00323     // TODO: need to account for alignment if user has set this
00324 
00325     // create_darray expects processes to be in row-major order,
00326     // find our global rank in row-major order
00327     int prow = M.Grid().Row();
00328     int pcol = M.Grid().Col();
00329     int row_major_rank = prow * pwidth + pcol;
00330 
00331     int gsizes[2];
00332     gsizes[0] = global_height;
00333     gsizes[1] = global_width;
00334     int distribs[2] = {MPI_DISTRIBUTE_CYCLIC, MPI_DISTRIBUTE_CYCLIC};
00335     // TODO: if using block sizes > 1, then change dargs below (BlockHeight, BlockWidth)
00336     int dargs[2] = {1, 1};
00337     int psizes[2];
00338     psizes[0] = pheight;
00339     psizes[1] = pwidth;
00340     MPI_Type_create_darray(ranks, row_major_rank, 2, gsizes, distribs, dargs, psizes, MPI_ORDER_FORTRAN, type, viewtype);
00341     MPI_Type_commit(viewtype);
00342 
00343     return;
00344 }
00345 
00346 void Write_MPI(const DistMatrix<DataType> &M, std::string basename = "DistMatrix", FileFormat format = BINARY, std::string title = "")
00347 {
00348     // TODO: error out if format != BINARY
00349 
00350     // TODO: use TypeMap<>() and templating to figure this out
00351     MPI_Datatype type = DataTypeMPI;
00352 
00353     // define our file name
00354     string filename = basename + "." + FileExtension(BINARY);
00355     const char* path = filename.c_str();
00356 
00357     // get MPI communicator
00358     MPI_Comm comm = M.Grid().Comm().comm;
00359 
00360     // get our rank
00361     int rank = M.Grid().Rank();
00362 
00363     // first, delete the existing file
00364     if (rank == 0) {
00365         /*
00366         int unlink_rc = unlink(path);
00367         if (unlink_rc != 0) {
00368             fprintf(stderr, "Error deleting file `%s'\n", path);
00369             fflush(stderr);
00370         }
00371         */
00372         MPI_File_delete(path, MPI_INFO_NULL);
00373     }
00374 
00375     // get global width and height of matrix
00376     Int global_width  = M.Width();
00377     Int global_height = M.Height();
00378 
00379     // define datatypes to describe local buffer and view into file
00380     MPI_Datatype mattype, viewtype;
00381     create_types(M, &mattype, &viewtype);
00382 
00383     // define hints for creating the file (e.g., number of stripes on Lustre)
00384     MPI_Info info;
00385     MPI_Info_create(&info);
00386     MPI_Info_set(info, "striping_factor", "10");
00387     //MPI_Info_set(info, "striping_factor", "80");
00388 
00389     // open the file
00390     MPI_File fh;
00391     MPI_Status status;
00392     char datarep[] = "native";
00393     int amode = MPI_MODE_WRONLY | MPI_MODE_CREATE;
00394     MPI_File_open(comm, path, amode, info, &fh);
00395 
00396     // done with the info object
00397     MPI_Info_free(&info);
00398 
00399     // truncate file to 0 bytes
00400 //    MPI_File_set_size(fh, 0);
00401 
00402     // set our view to write header (height and width as unsigned 32-bit ints)
00403     MPI_Offset disp = 0;
00404     MPI_File_set_view(fh, disp, MPI_UINT32_T, MPI_UINT32_T, datarep, MPI_INFO_NULL);
00405     if (rank == 0) {
00406         uint32_t dimensions[2];
00407         dimensions[0] = global_height;
00408         dimensions[1] = global_width;
00409         MPI_File_write_at(fh, 0, dimensions, 2, MPI_UINT32_T, &status);
00410     }
00411     disp += 2 * sizeof(uint32_t);
00412 
00413     // set view to write data
00414     MPI_File_set_view(fh, disp, type, viewtype, datarep, MPI_INFO_NULL);
00415 
00416     // write our portion of the matrix, since we set our view using create_darray,
00417     // all procs write at offset 0, the file view will take care of interleaving appropriately
00418     const char* buf = (const char*) M.LockedBuffer();
00419     MPI_File_write_at_all(fh, 0, buf, 1, mattype, &status);
00420 
00421     // close file
00422     MPI_File_close(&fh);
00423 
00424     // free our datatypes
00425     MPI_Type_free(&mattype);
00426     MPI_Type_free(&viewtype);
00427 
00428     return;
00429 }
00430 
00431 void Read_MPI(DistMatrix<DataType> &M, std::string filename, FileFormat format = BINARY, bool sequential = false)
00432 {
00433     // TODO: error out if format != BINARY
00434 
00435     // TODO: use TypeMap<>() and templating to figure this out
00436     MPI_Datatype type = DataTypeMPI;
00437 
00438     // define our file name
00439     const char* path = filename.c_str();
00440 
00441     // get MPI communicator
00442     MPI_Comm comm = M.Grid().Comm().comm;
00443 
00444     // get our rank
00445     int rank = M.Grid().Rank();
00446 
00447     // open the file
00448     MPI_File fh;
00449     MPI_Status status;
00450     char datarep[] = "native";
00451     int amode = MPI_MODE_RDONLY;
00452     int rc = MPI_File_open(comm, path, amode, MPI_INFO_NULL, &fh);
00453     if (rc != MPI_SUCCESS) {
00454         if (rank == 0) {
00455             cout << "Failed to open file `" << path << "'" << endl;
00456         }
00457         return;
00458     }
00459 
00460     // set displacement to beginning of file
00461     MPI_Offset disp = 0;
00462 
00463     // set our view to read header (height and width as unsigned 32-bit ints)
00464     uint32_t dimensions[2];
00465     MPI_File_set_view(fh, disp, MPI_UINT32_T, MPI_UINT32_T, datarep, MPI_INFO_NULL);
00466     if (rank == 0) {
00467         MPI_File_read_at(fh, 0, dimensions, 2, MPI_UINT32_T, &status);
00468     }
00469     disp += 2 * sizeof(uint32_t);
00470 
00471     // broadcast dimensions from rank 0
00472     MPI_Bcast(dimensions, 2, MPI_UINT32_T, 0, comm);
00473 
00474     // resize matrix to hold data
00475     Int global_height = dimensions[0];
00476     Int global_width  = dimensions[1];
00477     M.Resize(global_height, global_width);
00478 
00479     // now define datatypes to describe local buffer and view into file
00480     MPI_Datatype mattype, viewtype;
00481     create_types(M, &mattype, &viewtype);
00482 
00483     // set view to write data
00484     MPI_File_set_view(fh, disp, type, viewtype, datarep, MPI_INFO_NULL);
00485 
00486     // write our portion of the matrix, since we set our view using create_darray,
00487     // all procs write at offset 0, the file view will take care of interleaving appropriately
00488     char* buf = (char*) M.Buffer();
00489     MPI_File_read_at_all(fh, 0, buf, 1, mattype, &status);
00490 
00491     // close file
00492     MPI_File_close(&fh);
00493 
00494     // free our datatypes
00495     MPI_Type_free(&mattype);
00496     MPI_Type_free(&viewtype);
00497 
00498     return;
00499 }
00500 
00501 bool lbann::Layer::saveToFile(int fd, const char* dirname)
00502 {
00503 //    return writeDist(fd, filename, WB);
00504     char filepath[512];
00505     sprintf(filepath, "%s/WB_L%d_%03dx%03d", dirname, Index, WB->Height()-1, WB->Width()-1);
00506     if(WB->Grid().Rank() == 0) {
00507       cout << "Rank " << WB->Grid().Rank() << " saving layer " << Index << " to file " << filepath << endl;
00508     }
00509     Write(*WB, filepath, BINARY, "");
00510     //Write_MPI(WB, filepath, BINARY, "");
00511     return true;
00512 }
00513 
00514 bool lbann::Layer::loadFromFile(int fd, const char* dirname)
00515 {
00516 //   return readDist(fd, filename, WB);
00517     char filepath[512];
00518     sprintf(filepath, "%s/WB_L%d_%03dx%03d.bin", dirname, Index, WB->Height()-1, WB->Width()-1);
00519     struct stat buffer;
00520     Int restoreFileFound = 0;
00521     if (WB->Grid().Rank() == 0 && stat(filepath, &buffer) == 0) {
00522       restoreFileFound = 1;
00523     }
00524     mpi::Broadcast(&restoreFileFound, 1, 0, WB->Grid().Comm());
00525 
00526     if (restoreFileFound == 1) {
00527       if (WB->Grid().Rank() == 0) {
00528         cout << "Rank " << WB->Grid().Rank() << " restoring layer " << Index << " from file " << filepath << endl;
00529       }
00530       Read(*WB, filepath, BINARY, 1);
00531       //Read_MPI(WB, filepath, BINARY, 1);
00532       return true;
00533     } else {
00534       return false;
00535     }
00536 }
00537 
00538 bool lbann::Layer::saveToCheckpoint(int fd, const char* filename, uint64_t* bytes)
00539 {
00540     writeDist(fd, filename, *WB, bytes);
00541     // Need to catch return value from function
00542     optimizer->saveToCheckpoint(fd, filename, bytes);
00543     return true;
00544 }
00545 
00546 bool lbann::Layer::loadFromCheckpoint(int fd, const char* filename, uint64_t* bytes)
00547 {
00548     // TODO: implement reader for other matrix distributions
00549     readDist(fd, filename, (DistMat&) *WB, bytes);
00550     // Need to catch return value from function
00551     optimizer->loadFromCheckpoint(fd, filename, bytes);
00552     return true;
00553 }
00554 
00555 bool lbann::Layer::saveToCheckpointShared(const char* dir, uint64_t* bytes)
00556 {
00557     int rank = WB->Grid().Rank();
00558 
00559     char path[512];
00560     sprintf(path, "%s/WB_L%d_%03dx%03d", dir, Index, WB->Height()-1, WB->Width()-1);
00561     if(rank == 0) {
00562       cout << "Saving layer " << Index << " to file " << path << endl;
00563     }
00564     Write(*WB, path, BINARY, "");
00565     //Write_MPI(WB, path, BINARY, "");
00566 
00567     if (rank == 0) {
00568         *bytes += 2 * sizeof(int) + WB->Height() * WB->Width() * sizeof(DataType);
00569     }
00570 
00571     optimizer->saveToCheckpointShared(dir, Index, bytes);
00572 
00573     return true;
00574 }
00575 
00576 bool lbann::Layer::loadFromCheckpointShared(const char* dir, uint64_t* bytes)
00577 {
00578     int rank = WB->Grid().Rank();
00579 
00580     char path[512];
00581     sprintf(path, "%s/WB_L%d_%03dx%03d.bin", dir, Index, WB->Height()-1, WB->Width()-1);
00582 
00583     // check whether WB file exists
00584     struct stat buffer;
00585     int exists = 0;
00586     if (rank == 0 && stat(path, &buffer) == 0) {
00587         exists = 1;
00588     }
00589     MPI_Bcast(&exists, 1, MPI_INT, 0, MPI_COMM_WORLD);
00590 
00591     if (! exists) {
00592         return false;
00593     }
00594 
00595     // read WB file
00596     if (rank == 0) {
00597         cout << "Restoring layer " << Index << " from file " << path << endl;
00598     }
00599     Read(*WB, path, BINARY, 1);
00600     //Read_MPI(WB, path, BINARY, 1);
00601 
00602     if (rank == 0) {
00603         *bytes += 2 * sizeof(int) + WB->Height() * WB->Width() * sizeof(DataType);
00604     }
00605 
00606     optimizer->loadFromCheckpointShared(dir, Index, bytes);
00607     return true;
00608 }
00609 
00610 void lbann::Layer::fp_nonlinearity() {
00611 
00612   // Forward propagation
00613   m_activation_fn->forwardProp(*Acts);
00614 
00615   // Set bias row back to 1.0
00616   const Int local_row = Acts->LocalHeight() - 1;
00617   const Int global_row = Acts->GlobalRow(local_row);
00618   if(global_row == Acts->Height() - 1) {
00619     for(Int col = 0; col < Acts->LocalWidth(); ++col) {
00620       Acts->SetLocal(local_row, col, DataType(1));
00621     }
00622   }
00623 
00624 }
00625 
00626 void lbann::Layer::bp_nonlinearity() {
00627 
00628   // Backward propagation
00629   m_activation_fn->backwardProp(*Zs);
00630   if (m_activation_type != activation_type::ID) {
00631     Hadamard(*Ds, *Zs, *Ds);
00632   }
00633 
00634   // Set bias row back to 0.0
00635   const Int local_row = Ds->LocalHeight() - 1;
00636   const Int global_row = Ds->GlobalRow(local_row);
00637   if(global_row == Ds->Height() - 1) {
00638     for(Int col = 0; col < Ds->LocalWidth(); ++col) {
00639       Ds->SetLocal(local_row, col, DataType(0));
00640     }
00641   }
00642   
00643 }
